paper.title: Adding Symmetry Reduction to Uppaal

author.org: Department of Computing Science Aalborg University
Department of Computing Science Aalborg University

paper.venue: Formal Modeling and Analysis of Timed Systems
paper.abstract: We describe a prototype extension of the real-time model checking tool Uppaal with symmetry reduction. The symmetric data type scalarset, which is also used in the Murϕ model checker, was added to Uppaal’s system description language to support the easy static detection of symmetries. Our prototype tool uses state swaps, described and proven sound earlier by Hendriks, to reduce the space and memory consumption of Uppaal. Moreover, the reduction strategy is canonical, which means that the symmetries are optimally used. For all examples that we experimented with (both academic toy examples and industrial cases), we obtained a drastic reduction of both computation time and memory usage, exponential in the size of the scalar sets used.
